caption: My preferred place for tasty american food. got there near seven, it wasn't very crowded. the prices are well within reason for the quality.

The food was outstanding! My steak was cooked perfectly and the flavors were spot on. The menu is small but what we all ordered was fantastic. Look out for the surcharge, we were explained that it is to help pay for staff health insurance - we gladly supported that !!  I would definitely go back again.
American food and service here is above par. certainly worth a return visit. the place has a good feel to it. they have so many reviews for a reason.
American food, mmm, so tasty. quick and friendly service. the prices are good for what you get.
Friendly staff willing to accommodate your requests.

An amazing dinner experience.   Heirloom tomatoes were unbelievable.   The monkfish went on the menu this evening and in was prepared with a red curry sauce. So good. The sweet corn dessert is not to be missed.
Food and drinks were excellent.

An amazing dinner experience.   Heirloom tomatoes were unbelievable.   The monkfish went on the menu this evening and in was prepared with a red curry sauce. So good. The sweet corn dessert is not to be missed.

Really enjoyed my birthday dinner there! The staff is nice and knowledgeable. The inside is beautiful and makes you feel you are in Paris! Love the food and def recommend it. Cheaper than other high end restaurants yet you feel fancy and your date feels fancy too!

An excellent choice for date night - or any night! The restaurant is beautiful, the food is delicious and the staff is awesome. We'll definitely be back!  P.S. - Thank you to the entire staff for being so professional and making sure COVID-19 procedures are being followed. You guys are doing it right!

Awesome!  This was a family dinner for delayed celebration of a life changing event. Bellemore staff got us a post-card with manually written wishes, so nice and cute.  Amazing service, attentive waiter, proper (!) table distancing (which was very important to us). Food was great, could not finish as everyone got too full. Not that many fish options if that's what you are looking for. Loved Hibiscus Punch and Firebird sandwich.  Highly recommend, this was our second dinner at Bellemore - would come again. Thank you!
Beautiful. Will be back again ❤️

I had my b-day dinner at Bellemore and was blown away by their service and unique menu. If you are looking for an intimate and elegant night, than this is the place to go. Food was delicious, satisfying and beautifully presented. The atmosphere is very pleasant and relaxing. I highly recommend it.
Staff went above and beyond to provide excellent customer service. Will definitely return
Great customer service and great people to work with as a team
Excellent food, excellent service.
Great vibe, food is amazing and servers are very knowledgeable with food pairings.

Really interesting dishes and flavors here.  I thought the octopus and squid ink pasta were excellent.  Our server was really pleasant and offered to make me a mocktail since I am pregnant; it was delicious.  I would venture to guess the real cocktails are even better. Apparently, it is also one of the few places in that neighborhood that offers a Friday happy hour.
The food was all well prepared. Atmosphere was low light and relaxed. Not too crowded at all but still busy.

We are always looking for a unique brunch experience. Many friends suggested that we needed to try Fat RIce. Beginning to end, Fat Rice was an adventure. After settling in with a Mango Mimosa, we tried the pork and Ginger Dumplings with X.O. Sauce. Nice and spicy with that umami goodness. Next we enjoyed the Spicy Prawns and Minchi Mosca. The Prawns are one of those decadent dishes that you savor till the end. Wow! The minchi was that beautiful end to our brunch with the soft-cooked egg yolk rounding out the ground meat and spices. Lastly, service was excellent. Laura, one of the bartenders, guided us through the menu as well as our meal. Brunch does get a little expensive, but it is memorable!
Great place and atmosphere, and good staff.
The customer service is regularly efficient, fantastic character, friendly staff members. Will return here again when I get in town.
Great place to spend new year's eve!
Amazing atmosphere and good service. Squash was delicious

(Translated by Google) The 24 knife lunch can be said to be very economical, can't you say the experience, but the price is ok Good environment, good food, service may be slow due to late arrival  (Original) 24刀的午餐可以说是很经济实惠了 味道么不能说经验 但是性价比很ok 环境不错 菜不错 可能是由于来得时间太晚所以服务有点慢

Just came here for dinner and it was very underwhelming. The food was good but for the price there was not very much. And not that small plates are bad, the whole meal just left us very unsatisfied. Cocktails were great, nice wine selection, but seems like a place to go to for the atmosphere more than anything. Will probably go back for their happy hour and get some oysters, but I doubt I'd go back for dinner.
If you don't want to be full and you want food that's "good", this is the place to be.

I picked this place for my boyfriend and I to go to for Restaurant Week 2020 and I’m so glad I did! The ambiance of the restaurant was upscale, classy, glamorous and chic I loved the color scheme and decor.  Our server was very professional yet friendly and she gave us recommendations and specials for the night. We ended up getting Venison Tartare, Kona Kanpachi, Shrimp & Grits, Rigatoni, Artic Char, Skirt Steak, Triple Chocolate Mousse Cake, Banana Pudding. Every single thing was absolutely delicious! I would 100% come back here!
Absolutely phenomenal!
Beautiful setting and delicious food, mixed cocktails could be better.
Food was great.  Service a little slow

We went for Restaurant week 2020 and I had a good experience. But my boyfriend was not full after the meal and he said he won't go back. Arctic char was good. The dessert sorbet was too sour. Everything else mediocre.
This is a bar of dreams. We found it by accident but weren't disappointed. Very helpful staff as we didn't have reservation. The whole experience , ambience , food,  cocktails was just world class.

One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago! The decor is beautiful, and the dishes are expertly crafted and delicious. Prices are admittedly high, but worth it in my book. Restaurant Week is a great opportunity to experience this place for much less than normal.
Worthy!
(Translated by Google) Very good all thanks  (Original) Muy bueno todo gracias
Nice place to dine. Staff friendly.  $$$

Amazing attention to detail, exquisite food and insanely good service. Did a 5 course tasting menu for two, night before Valentine's day. About $500 out the door. Near perfect meal. Used to have two michelin stars when the organization rated LA establishments. Most definitely deserved.

I’ve wanted to try this place for a while based on the reviews and pictures. However, I tried it last night, and every course was so consistently underwhelming and over priced that I will never go back. The meat balls were dry. The gnocchi was mushy. The carrot hummus was a little salty and the skirt steak wasn’t bad or good. However, it did cost $36. Don’t believe the hype. There are so many better restaurants in the city.
A wonderful meal and a unique atmosphere. Loved it

Always a beautiful place to dine at. One of the very few fine dining restaurants where also serves lunch so we could enjoy our lunch in a beautiful restaurant under the natural sunlight!  Service is professional and warm, they re-made my steak salad less than 10 minutes when I told the server the steak was a bit burnt. The sauce for Hamachi was a bit too tart for our taste, but I did like the pumpkin seeds in this dish(Boka restaurant also have the similar dish on their dinner menu with a different fish, and the flavor was better balanced). Overall, a great place to have lunch at where they offered three courses lunch menu for the price of $24.
Nice decor but food was "meh". Overpriced & not much to say about the food.
Had a fabulous burger
Drinks, food, service, and atmosphere here are VERY good. Love the lunch menu.
Food and service was excellent

A must when visiting Chicago!  Their menu is always changing and that makes it even more exciting! The cocktails are one of a kind! The staff is great. It's one of those restaurants where you never have the same experience once ,but it does always get better!
The service blew me away, and every dish I had was full of flavor and cooked to perfection!
Awesome place. What's more to say. I loved there.
Really good food and not as pricey as some other Randolph restaurants.
Had drinks and a few small bites waiting to meet friends.  Food was good but wish there was a more extensive selection. Service and drinks were great.

Had a business lunch here and was very impressed. Food was excellent starting with the squash soup. We enjoyed the sweet potato appetizer. The entree was the Fire Chicken sandwich which was very well prepared with the perfect amount of heat. Conversation friendly for a business lunch and service was very good.

Inventive dishes, outstanding service, a chic yet approachable ambiance that sets the tone for a great evening, but the food then exceeds that expectation. Swanky modern jazz in the background, unique architectural details, and interesting/unusual decor make the environment as tasty to the eye as the food is to the palate. A truly outstanding experience.

Had the pleasure of accompanying a friend here today she has been here several other times including on her last birthday. She said it's by far one of her favorite restaurant. A lot of the photos make the portion seems small but everything we ordered today was a rather decent sized portion. Including the steak and avocado dish. We also had the clams. The carrot toast doesn't taste much like carrot but it is absolutely amazing oh, so much so that I ordered another serving of carrot toast. The person who greeted us at the front door and sat us at our table I thought was just a host,. I was impressed when he jumped in and offered to take our order. Turns out his name was Tim, the general manager. Very professional, very passionate. As a business owner myself I know good customer service when I see it, or a lack thereof. This place was spotless, and the service from the bellboys to the waiters right up to management goes above and beyond. The bartender was also helpful.

This place is nothing short of spectacular! Well trained staff, great service, mouthwatering food and stunning decor! What may can you ask from a restaurant?! Also, the cocktails and extensive wine list are worth a gander. If you are in Chicago, this is a spot not to be missed by any means.
Great service and fantastic food. Came here for my birthday and the staff was so pleasant. Great atmosphere too!

Ok. Service was impeccable.  Not 3 minutes went by without being attended to. Classy and polite staff that was both caring and scarily attentive to your every want before you realize it. Had the octopus and halibut. It far exceeded my already high expectations.
Incredible 3-course lunch menu!!
Elegant but casual room. Noise level not overwhelming. Great service and food.
On the pricey side but worth it.
Wow this place was awesome.  I don’t think I have ever had an Arctic char cooked so perfectly.  Really impressed.

We dined at the Bellemore for my Birthday dinner! Atmosphere, spirits, food and staff were top of the line. The dinner menu recommends 3 courses per person. For the first course, we devoured the KONA KANPACHI with fermented tomato, horseradish, charred onion & mandarin and VEAL SWEETBREADS glazed with molasses, charred onions, dried persimmons & sherry vinegar. Highly recommend both! For second course, we devoured the WINTER SALAD of endives with red wine poached pears, blue cheese, toasted walnuts & calamansi vinegar and PORCINI RIGATONI with wild burgundy snails, mushroom bolognese & whipped parmesan. Highly recommend both! For our third course, we devoured the GREEN CIRCLE CHICKEN with red wine hollandaise, stuffed cabbage & smoked egg yolk and WILD ARTIC CHAR with brussels sprouts, smoked trout roe, crispy buckwheat & black walnuts. Highly recommend both! Cannot wait to go back!

We were here for a birthday celebration. The environment is very romantic with a chill vibe. Decor is modern and beautiful, and the servers are super nice and accommodating. They even signed a birthday card and gave us a slice of chocolate cake. My favorite on the menu is the Wagyu Tri Tip. The Slow Roasted Porcelet has a bit too much tendon, so the texture was not as good as expected.

Waiter was animated and fun and formal and casual and elegant and friendly all at the same time. Food was beyond beyond delicious. The caviar dish was $ 49. I said REALLY! Its an appetizer BUT if you tell me its worth it I will order it. The waiter said YES, it IS worth it. Seriously after one bite ONE BITE!!!!!!!! We just wanted to say...cancel everything else we ordered and bring us four more of these. Everything OFF THE CHAIN!!! Everything mouth explosion.

Portion of meal was small but the presentation was of my standard. The service was great! I went to celebrate my sister’s birthday and the staff made a card in which everyone signed it. This was a wonderful experience. Thank you all.
Great food great staff wonderful place to eat
Innovative cuisine with an Italian flare
Fernando was extremely knowledgeable about the textures of the dishes. Just amazing. This was only the first time, but definitely not the last. Go pre-fix!
Went for lunch and was not expecting much, however I was pleasantly surprised about the quality and the taste. I will return again for dinner.
Great food and amazing wine list!
Beautiful place and delicious food!
Really great food and service!
A little birdy said Management forces employees to clock out and still work
Fantastic. The tasting menu was impeccable and delightful. They accommodated my dairy allergy without issue and the waiter was very knowledgeable. Beautiful venue and even great music.

Group dinner in the back room. Amazing service from the hostess, bartender, servers and staff.  Great variety of options.  Stylish and enjoyable atmosphere.  Halibut was cooked perfectly had great flavor.  The prices were above average.  I would visit here again.
I cannot say enough about the service. Nick was an excellent server and the chef is a genius. The flavors, the freshness and the portions were all perfect.
Food is awesome , Atmosphere is fantastic, drinks are so good. really had a good time. thanks

Great food and great dining experience. The menu is very unique with several different types of food that are great for sharing. We got the venison tartar and foie gras which were both really great and unique dishes. We also got the fish and some smaller plates which were all very tasty. The inside atmosphere is also very cool with a modern and art deco mix. The bar had great cocktails and the service was outstanding. I'd definitely recommend.
Lovely ambiance. Service was attentive but not intrusive and the food was excellent A must do next time in Chicago
Tried a few new things and everything was exceptional. The staff was outstanding and very attentive.
Great food!
Absolutely incredible. Our server was also knowledgeable, amicable, and very professional.

Food is delicious and has many creative spins to American classics.  I really liked the carrot toast, which came with roasted carrot, pistachios, mint and lime.  The sweet potato tots are also really good; it's fried in a batter that makes the dish very fluffy and lighter than usual tater tots.  I loved the fried chicken sandwich.  Definitely has a kick (I believe chili powder?) but just all around great.

To start things off, the staff were very welcoming. I had multiple people come and greet me, as well as check up on me while I was waiting for the rest of my party to arrive. The interior is stupidly beautiful. The lighting could be a bit brighter, but I'm sure that would defeat the purpose of the ambiance for the mood. The windows alone let in enough light to keep the place lit until Sunset. Moving onto the food, everything was as expected, for the most part. To start off with appetizers, we had ordered the Wild Burgundy Snails, Veal Sweetbreads, Hokkaido Scallop Crudo and the infamous Oyster Pie. Each dish was full of flavor and delicious. The only exception to this was the scallop crudo, which wasn't to my particular taste. I would've preferred it to be more smoky, but again, personal preference, no ill intent towards the dish. I also wish that the Oyster Pie were bigger. I had never realized how small it was until I had ordered it. For the price of it, you would assume a bigger slice (pictures are deceiving). Moving on to entrees, we had ordered three: Wild Arctic Char, Wagyu Tri-Tip and Lamb Loin. All three were equally amazing but if I had to pick, it'd be a split down the middle between the lamb and wagyu. Both were cooked to perfection and tasted amazing. To finish off dinner, we ordered two desserts: Roasted Vanilla Pavlova and Tres Leches Cake. The Tres Leches Cake didn't really taste like Tres Leches, but that's not a bad thing, it was delicious none-the-less. The pavlova was very sweet, but not overly to the point of having a possible toothache afterwards. To end the night, we were presented with complimentary confections. The menu may be small, but it does the job. I had a party of four and this was a sufficient amount of food; however, I would have been more than happy to order at least two-to-three more items to taste.

Food was enjoyable. Fresh, excellent and unique spring ingredients and flavors. Portions left something to desire, esp when dining vegan. Overpriced for what it is and 3x for the wine list. Good food, but not enough to repeat.
Fantastic food and service. Great wine list.

We enjoyed our dinner at Bellemore. We planned dinner close to the Lyric Opera. The Cast of West Side Story gave a outstanding performance. The musical has social issues that run true today. Our dinner was good as we tried several dishes including the Day Boat Scallops with FAVA BEANS. To my surprise there was Hannibal Lecter at the next table having the Sweet Breads. I kept a eye on him just in Case!! The Atlantic Char was very tasty in a flavorful broth. I will say our server Dalton was one of our best ever servers. He had excellent knowledge of the Menu. His timing was experienced and right on cue he arrived unhurried in a busy restaurant.
...great presentation, nice combination of the flavors, meat and fish were tender and juicy with very thin crispy crust, great service
The ambiance, the delicious food, the presentation, the service, all get 5 stars! It is a wonderful gem of a restaurant!
Food was delicious,  staff nailed it
Amazing food and service. Each dish was a hit with the table, especially the foie gras.

Food is indescribably delicious!!!! Service is amazing... my friend forgot her reading glasses, so they even had couple extra pairs she tried and was able to read the menu!! Thanks for the great experience!
Be sure to make room for dessert!
Fantastic meal
Slow service.  Good food.
Service was phenomenal (Kelly was our server), the drinks were great, lamb and carrot pasta dishes a bit bland, Monkfish and buccatini were great.
Incredibly salty food and that's coming from a guy who has a major salt tooth. Service was very good.
The food and drinks match the atmosphere.  The service is incredible.

Did the tasting menu with wine pairing. Was very impressed with overall ambience, presentation of food, and wine selection. Will be back. Just FYI, definitely not a place for an inexpensive night if want to do it right.
Great food and excellent service
Small menu but the food was really good with some unique items like carrot toast.

The food was presented beautifully but our service was inconsistent and at times non-existent. Our server was absent for the majority of our meal and when we asked another server for water it never came. On a food note, the apple dessert was our favorite with all the different textures and sweetness. The restaurant is beautiful and the food was enjoyable but I think there are much better options in the West Loop.
Food was DELICOUS. We got the steak, pasta, and the cinnamon apple dessert. Worth every penny, and there were many of those sacrificed. But they earned every coin!
Wow.
Elegant, beautiful and delicious

I stopped here for a glass of wine recently with a friend and had a nice time. The ambience is very classy- this is definitely an upscale, pricier restaurant. I suggest taking a look at the menu in advance! While we didn’t eat here, the menu looked great. Our waiter was great too- very polite. I would come back here!
Amazing selection of food. I came here for my birthdat dinner and had an amazing time. The venison tartar, scallops and Alaskan Char were amazing.
The food, atmosphere, and service are outstanding. Incredible wine selection and a great, innovative menu that seems to constantly change. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.
Great American food
We loved the Bellemore. The food was amazing, the service fantastic and it was a beautiful and relaxing atmosphere. We can't wait to go back.
First class.
Lovely food and service. Food took quite a while to come out, and the wine list was rather small. Very pleasant experience overall.

Bellemore was very kind to us when we visited for our anniversary. Champagne, an extra dessert, and a card signed by all of the staff! The food was great and we enjoyed the ambiance. Highly recommend!
Delicious experience! And I mean experience. The food was unlike anything I've tasted. Also the cocktails!
The food here is incredible and the service was terrific! I highly recommend trying the Bellemore.
Great service, great atmosphere, restaurant week menu leaves you wanting more from the regular menu. Will be definitely going back!

Had an incredible dining experience at Bellemore with a group of friends for Restaurant Week. The scallops were perfectly cooked and likely the highlight of the meal, though every dish was delicious with excellent presentation. The servers were both attentive and helpful, and the space was very classy. Would definitely recommend for a special night out.
This was an OUTSTANDING experience. We were waited on by several people. The food was amazing and the service even better.
Loved the experience there during the Chicago restaurant week. I really enjoyed the Chocolate Mousse!

Flawless.  Both the food and the drinks were amazing and the staff were amazing.  I went for my anniversary and the staff even got us a card and signed it.  Really touching and we were very impressed.  Highly recommend.
Best meal I've ever had!
(Translated by Google) It's a beautiful place, I really liked it.  (Original) lugar mais lindo gostei muito ótimo

Went for lunch during Restaurant Week during Polar Vortex and restaurant was half full. Beautiful place inside. 1st course was ok (soup was bland but had good amount of veggies / sweet potato tots just ok). Highlights were both desserts and the ciappino. Would definitely go back to try dinner on the weekend.

Only had lunch there, but it was very good. Food was delicious and well concieved and well prepared. Had a stak salad with cashews avacado and greens and an apple cheese cake dessert. Little quibles, but overal km a special meal. Must go back for dinner to test the real skill

From the beautiful modern accented and bird themed dining space, stellar wait staff and delicious high quality fine dining entrees, Bellemore easily secures the spot for my top favorite restaurants in Chicago. They are killing it! Food aside, I really appreciate their thoughtful cards to their guests who celebrate their anniversaries and birthdays here. Love how coordinated the restaurant runs. I wouldn't be anymore excited to celebrate my birthday with my honey during Chicago Restaurant Week. Their Icelandic cod cioppino, carrot toast and chocolate mousse cake are the most notable items on the menu. Absolutely love the flavor of the carrot puree and blackened lime shavings on top of the toast. The Icelandic cod toast is incredibly buttery paired with a rich autumn pumpkin spiced soup. Thank you for the absolutely divine experience.
Ordered: Joan kappa chi; venison tartare, Icelandic cod, apple roulade. And the mezcal cocktail drink. Like  all of them especially the venison tartare, really sparkling flavor.

My partner and I went for date night at Bellemore and were extremely satisfied. Everyone from the hostesses to the servers were very kind. The food was great too! HIGHLY recommend the friend black rice. That was delicious! Would get that every time I go.
Absolutely perfect fine dining. I was a little skeptical of the oyster pie, but it was basically life changingly good.
Beautiful restaurant with food and service to match. Bellemore is our new favorite from the Boka Group.

Bellemore has to be one of my top dining experiences in Chicago.  It was amazing from start to finish.  The shaved foie gras appetizer was a dish I never wanted to end, and the dessert was the perfect end to the night.  I wish I had been more adventurous than the chicken entree because there are so many excellent options here!
The salad and second course were excellent for our party of three.  The entrees were fine, but not unique.  Two of us had the salmon and the other the chicken.  Service was excellent.
Came for a work lunch. Great ambiance. Certainly a place I could have a few drinks in the evening. Menu was small but good. Food was worth the price. I’ll come back.
This place is gorgeous.
Excellent food and excellent personnel. The degustation menu is outstanding. You need to try the oyster pie
Amazing

Bellemore was wonderful.  I was caught up in a very long traffic jam and they were able to hold a table for me.  The decor is beautiful.  The food and service couldn't be better.  The ladies room is equipped with additional things like a sewing kit and spot remover.  Nice touches.
Definitely recommend the tasting menu. Great way to try many different options that you would normally forget.

The service was great and the experience was fantastic. We went with the tasting menu with beverage pairing. The unique courses mixed with the nicely paired drinks made for a very fun time. But with that said, nothing they served to us was out of this world.

Well what a disaster. Can't believe this place got 5 stars. Tastes were mismatched - everything we tried was just...bland and nothing really special.  Even the $65 3 bite oyster pie wasn't really a wow.  Definitely not at the level where a $$$ restaurant should be.  The service was excellent thought, no complaints there. The only reason I gave two stars.  Also their mojioto drink was fantastic - would come back but only to the bar area!
Wonderful experience. We were on a special experience so we toured the kitchen and spent time with the chef.  Creative and dynamic dishes.

Complex textures made these dishes stand out- beyond the display, interesting flavor combinations, and unique ingredients, the thoughtful way they're constructed makes all the difference.  Favorite was the Icelandic cod.

Only been for lunch but holy cow is it amazing. The chicken sandwich and the burger are uncommonly good. Prices aren't amazing but for higher end food comparable to Avec it's reasonable. Looking forward to going for dinner sometime.
Foody heaven in Chicago. Elegant ambiance, great service .
Recommend. Good stop

The food, the service and the ambiance were great. Food had great flavor. The presentation was beautiful. The couple next to us had the tasting menu and it looked really good. The 2 top tables are very close, so it's hard not to hear the conversation. It was our anniversary and they really made us feel special. Great place for a special celebration. Would highly recommend.

The tasting menu is out of this world. From start to finish it was delicious and the portions were surprisingly large. The decor is a little bizarre in places but easily overlooked when you are devouring the venison tartar! I was sad when Embeya closed but thankfully Bellemore is delivering at this great location.

Fantastic food! The wine pairing and tasting menu is an incredible deal.  The wine isn't poured lightly and the tasting menu will not leave you hungry at all.  The oyster pie.... Awesome and I don't like oysters!!!
(Translated by Google) Food is tasty. Service is nice. The price level is relatively high  (Original) Söögid maitsvad. Teenindus meeldiv. Hinnatase suhteliselt kõrge
Awesome restaurant, superb food, excellent service, stellar atmosphere
Brilliant food in taste, texture and delivery.

My wife and I were tempted by  nice pictures of the ambience shown on the net ... unfortunately the food was very poor : we had a venison tartare which was way too dressed by several ingredients that covered completely the original taste of the meet and a veggie soup too simple . But the worst was the foie gras : shaved like partisan cheese and too sweet ! I had a spaghetti chitarra ... I am Italian so difficult to judge cause I might be excessively demanding . Overall the food experience was poor and the price not proportional to the quality and preparation of the food .
Dessert was amazing, sushi great as well
Amazing food and service!

Excellent food, service, atmosphere...an all-around perfect experience. I had the salad and chicken...great presentation and flavors. My date's meal was equally wonderful (black bass). Loved this place so much that I bought a gift certificate for a relative's birthday. 😊🍷🎂

Bellemore stole my heart, And trap my soul there with them.  I have to go back to get them back.  The food is beyond amazing,  wine pairings and introduction is professional and we love the cozy environment. We had an ultimate dining experience with Bellemore and I can’t wait to go back again.
Great appetizers. Main dishes not as great.
It is spot on!  Food, wine !  Staff is knowledgeable and delightful!  Can't wait to go back!
Fantastic!   Had an amazing meal.  The venison tartare was incredible as was the salad and both of the fish dishes.   Everything was outstanding.
Had wagyu and octopus,  both were awesome. Good cocktails as well. Portion size is small though.

(Translated by Google) This is undoubtedly the best establishment in Chicago that we have to do ... A precise refined inventive cuisine, a service worthy of many Michelin stars at fair prices ... and above all a monumental wine list with a big crush for the champagne menu. Well done I will come back for sure.  (Original) Voilà sans conteste le meilleur établissement de Chicago que nous avons à faire ... Une cuisine juste précise raffinée inventive , un service digne de nombreux étoilés Michelin des prix juste ... et surtout surtout une carte des vins monumentales avec un gros coup de cœur pour la carte des champagnes . Bravo je reviendrai c est certain .

Absolutely decadent and divine. Service was outstanding, the food and wine positively superb! Dine here for a delicious and swanky experience with friends or family; you will all leave incandescently happy.
Exceptional good cuisine. Must a try
The meal was outstanding!!  Each dish was so flavorful!! Loved it!
Very good. Food is excellent as was the service. We enjoyed the tasting menu, which offered an eclectic yet balanced lineup of excellent offerings.
Excellent food and service
Went for the famous oyster pie, which was good but pricey (~$60) for 2 bites. The other food and the ambience were more impressive
Good ambience, great staff.  Food was great although portions are a bit small

There was not expense spared in building out the space. The bar top is solid marble with a Chicago rail!! Such a pretty bar. The food. The menu wasn't really my speed but I did try some sweet bread with butter which I enjoyed.

Ate here by myself. Wish I had a companion as I wanted to try half the menu. Beautiful decor with an upscale vibe. The venison tartar was fabulous. The duck was very tasty although I felt it was cut a little thick. The dessert was a cherry coconut mousse which was sensational also. Great meal. I will be back to try the suckling pig and grilled octopus.

Okay, let’s talk about this place. No - let’s RAVE about this place. I visited here on a trip to Chicago from a friend’s recommendation about a month or two ago. I STILL dream of this place and it’s food. This restaurant deserves every award and accolade coming its way because it is absolutely one of the top restaurants in the US (not just Chicago).  Service is phenomenal and genuine. The people who work here 1. Truly appear to love what they do and 2. Truly appear to enjoy serving you and being friendly.  The food is... incredible. Anything I say here won’t do it justice, so go there and get some yourself! 😋 The flavors are complex and continue to transform and surprise as you eat the meal.  One more thing - I loved and was surprised by the bathrooms. They’re incredibly thoughtful, with wipes, hair ties, tampons, etc.  My ultimate thought is that this restaurant deserves a Michelin star. I’ve been to other Michelin star restaurants that do less than this place, and definitely slip from my memory sooner. I’ll be recommending this place and dreaming of its flavors for months and years to come, and I would definitely trip to Chicago purely to attend this restaurant again.
Loved the food, our server Sarah was the best! I can't wait to go back and eat the rest of the menu.

AMAZING! We celebrated our anniversary and decided to go to Chicago for some Gastro tour celebration. Bellemore is our second stop and it just blew our mind.  First of all, we booked the place for 8:45pm noon Saturday night. However, we came an hour early a d they were able to seat us. We brought our 4 year old daughter and they were cool with it. be  Our serve, Gabby (spelling ?!?) was amazing, friendly and thoughtful. We had complimentary champagne and desserts as a part of our celebration, and all were delicious. We ordered the magical oyster pie (it's honestly really magical), tartare and a cocktail. We loved every sip and bite we had.  The place itself is so lovely, and well-decorated. A+ for the ladies room, they provided small emergency stuff there, like hairpin, mint, roller. Wonderful.  I'd love to come back again!
Fancy & good. Would recommend their cocktails.
Super service and very good food
Fantastic decor and delicious food.  BOKA group is consistently great and providing a great and memorable dining experience.
Nice but not the best of Boka restaurants

Oh wow, I was blown away by the quality of dishes at Bellemore. Makes me feel like I need to come back to Chicago again to try more dishes on the menu! The chicken must be the most tender I've tasted in my life! Shaved foie gras was extremely interesting and paired with the other ingredients in the dish makes for such a magical mix of flavours! Oh and I almost forgot the sweetbread. Even if you aren't a fan of sweetbread, do yourself a favour and try it out at Bellemore and perhaps then you will become a convert!
First class all the way. High design, delicious food and professional service. Worth adding your list!
KONA KAMPACHI TARTARE and delicious hamburger for lunch. Very pleased with the service.
Thrilling menu and really engaged staff.  This could be a new pillar in Chicago's restaurant pantheon.
Great menu and atmosphere. Highly recommend the Farro Verde, Foie Gras, and venison tartare. All had excellent mix of textures and flavors.
Loved the rabbit!
Amazing. Service and food as good as it gets.

The old Embeya space reborn. Still a elegant space with soaring ceilings. Close to the loop for after work gatherings. Outside the loop so you can avoid complete congestion prior to a show. The food was all presented and prepared very well. The vegetable soup is quite nice with and interesting, very subtle sweet/sour note to broth. My salad was balanced and dressed just enough so as to promote the flavor profiles of the ingredients. I had the rabbit as my main and was also done very well.
Epic experience! Beautiful restaurant and a wonderful selection of amazing dishes. Can't wait to return

Oyster pie with caviar, shaved foie gras with gewurztraminer gelee green apple and raspberry marmalade: some of the most elegant and delicious bites I’ve had in Chicago! Fantastic cocktail program too.  Oyster pie price was at first a bit astounding for the size of the pie, but it actually comes with a glass of Ruinart bubbly for $65 total (and the pie is phenomenal).
Excelent food & Service

Not worth the price (as of April 2018). Food was petty good: appetizing and original, but most comparable fine dining bills come with friendlier staff, larger drink selections, and a more comfortable ambiance. This could all be overlooked if the food was top-notch, but the originality wasn't enough to justify the small menu and huge price. Oyster Pie and Calamansi Tart we're the high notes, but the tartare was stringy, pork was salty, fish was tough, pasta sauce tasted like lime juice, and the goat cheese salad was just a goat cheese salad.  3 stars for the benefit of the doubt that prices were jacked up to manage the over-hyped demand, which I get, but maybe they went too far for me.
Make sure to try the breads, fantastic.

We dined there on 3.24.18 at the end of the evening.  The restaurant is just a few months old and sets the standard for hipsters going out on the town (at least for this month).  I am a pretty serious wine guy.  There are no heavy hitter wines on this menu but they did offer a wonderful wine menu that paired perfectly with the menu and they had for more French than I though possible there.  That's a great start.  Energetic enthusiastic staff another great plus.  Hip groovster décor by someone who know what they were doing.  All set the perfect stage for the food which I expected to be more flash than substance and was wrong.  Their signature Hawaiian rolls?  Well, I have never liked a sweet roll.  I would say these were the best of the genre that I've had.   Spring salad with goat cheese?  Sure its wonderful but its done everywhere.  New spin here and dead on.  Toasted granola was unexpected and I did not plan on liking it, but loved it.  We ordered an extra salad.  Cornish hen...nice but boring?  Nope, it was sublime.  Really spectacular.   Aged duck?  The few places that do duck in the US usually do it poorly.  This was perfectly seasoned, cooked, and presented in a new and fun way.  Seafood spaghetti was a bit disappointing so avoid.  Lamb belly was amazing.  Big thumbs up.  Deserts were also creative but grounded.  Too trendy for us? Yeah, probably.  Worth the trip?  Absolutely.  Change it up and every once in a while go hipster I say!
Soo yummy.  Had the squid, rolls, and prawns for appetizers.  Had the duck and steak as main courses.  All very flavorful and great ambience

Awesome decor and ambiance. Upscale vibe. Small plates, but you're coming for the chef and unbelievable flavor. I had the roasted duck and it was beautifully cooked with a crisp exterior and the pairings on the plate worked so well to bring out the duck's rich flavor. I could see this being a great date spot but it also worked nicely for my dinner with my boss.
Solid drinks.

"The room" is most inviting and the staff very competent, friendly and the key to my 'its ok' rating. Quite frankly, the food was average; not a lot of flavor for the price. Very disappointed as my expectations were high as I look for a "regular" place to go and this place had all the elements to secure my commitment!
Great food and great service in an artsy setting
Amazing food, service and ambience.
very classy and great option if you like fine dining , make sure to hold enough money.
Incredible food and experience. The wait staff is amazing and helped to make the dining experience unforgettable. Definitely check it out!
Incredible. All around perfect experience. Above and beyond!
The scotch and pear cocktail was really good. We also really enjoyed the dumplings and the duck dish.
Three words Fab-u-lous from the food, to the ambiance to the service.
Wonderful experience at Bellemore. The winter salad and dry aged steak was 👌 and Kevin, our waiter, was very attentive.

YOU MUST ORDER the Hawaiian rolls!!! Fantastic upscale restaurant with a wonderful selection of libations. Our server Kevin was a true connoisseur of the fare. He did a fantastic job pairing our beverages with the dishes we ordered and made some wonderful suggestions for dessert. Most definitely one of the best places to eat in Chicago. The decor and lighting were delightful for a late dinner and evening of conversation. Truly a pleasure to dine at this establishment.
We expected more.  The pasta had bits of shell in it and the fish skin on the bass was not crispy. Good food, but we would not go back.
Love the ambiance. Food combination of flavors were excellent.
Nice new addition to the West loop

The decor, service and food we're fantastic. The interior design has a bit of an classic hotel feel to it. The cocktails are artfully crafted and delicious. We order the tartare and it had a great amount of spice and flavor without too much added fats. The Cod was well cooked and paired with excellent sides. This is fine dining serving portions so if you came hungry, the tasting menu may be your speed. By the way, the desserts are a perfect finish, so don't over look the last menu.
So amazingly good.

The service and food were very good. The drinks were tasty as well. The best dishes were the shaved foie gras Salad and Cornish Hen. Hawaiian rolls were tasty. We ordered a dessert and got a complimentary one as well. The complimentary dessert was very good. It was a good mix of crunchy, tart, and sweet.
Upscale restaurant and a must to visit! Amazing service, food, and drinks.

Bellemore is the latest installment in Boka restaurant group's sterling stable of culinary gems. At the time of this writing, Bellemore has been open for 4 weeks yet it already seems confident in flavor, aesthetic, and attitude. The menu is simple, split into three sections, and practically begging to be shared. We enjoyed a light and acidic Hiramasa crudo, which was paired with mandarins and marinated in vinegar. The Winter Salad was impressive for it's texture, variety, and presentation. Pumpkin seeds for crunch, beets for sweetness, whipped Gorgonzola for a smooth, salty finish along with tangy pomegranate seeds. Our server suggested we try the braised lamb belly, and with Greek chef Jimmy Papadopoulos at the helm, I was confident in the execution. It was succulent without being greasy and along with the savory persimmon marmalade and sheep's milk feta made for a balanced composition. The Chestnut papardelle was another textural success blending roasted pears with chestnuts and shaved truffle, creating a complex but satisfying flavor. Finally the duck done 3 ways had the feeling and finesse for a signature dish. Duck dry aged for 20 days fashioned into a fried croquette, a wonderfully crispy and flavorful duck breast with farro, and a decadent duck heart sausage. Desserts were also well executed and ornate, adding to the artistic flair of Bellemore's ambience. Service was excellent, thorough, and knowledgeable. The environments design is flawless with brief aberrations that add character. I will definitely be coming back!
Food was stunning. Amazing. Just a little bit expensive

Some of the most flavorful and romantic food we have had in the city this year! Chef Jimmy Papadopoulos thank you!! *Snap*  Amazing pallette! Thank you for wonderful service, a beautiful environment, and delicious-flavorful-romantic food xo

A really nice new restaurant in the west loop.  I don't normally comment on valet service but I did like the setup with using mobile devices so you can have your car ready as you pay your check. The space is beautiful with a few different areas, similar to other Boka group designs. Bathrooms were exceptionally well stocked for ladies. Service was very attentive and our server was able to make some good recommendations.  No gluten free or vegetarian menus but the server can guide you. Food was well presented and looked great on the plate.  Flavors well well balanced but not overly bold.  We tried multiple items from pasta (our daughter loved it) to 2 different fish dishes.  All tasted great. Cocktails were a bit below our expectations given the great drinks at Boka.  Wine and beer selection were good. For the price point, I would expect just a little bit more. Our check for 3 with tip was ~$350 with 2 drinks each.  Good for a special occasion.
Amazing food, and top notch service! Absolutely recommend dinner or cocktails here!
